placeInfo: {'id': '315668', 'name': 'Thaala Bentota Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3370, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.423335, 'longitude': 79.9963, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d315668-Reviews-Thaala_Bentota_Resort-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.brownshotels.com/thaalabentota/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 79, 'count3': 240, 'count4': 781, 'count5': 2195}}
text:
This hotel was great!  The breakfast and dinner was very good with a variety of food. Chicken, pork and seafood were available. Access to the beach is directly behind the hotel; 2 minute walk. The landscape of the hotel was beautiful, especially at night with lamps in the palm trees. The breeze from the ocean made it relaxing to sit outside during the evening. The rooms were clean, friendly staff and tuk tuk taxis right outside the hotel (for cheap) if you want to explore the city. The only thing I would suggest is a children‚Äôs play area but the beach and pool kept my children occupied well enough. I recommend this hotel. 

Bryan
U.S.A.
title: Great stay! Beautiful hotel, quick beach access.

text:
We had wondeful stay at Thaala bentota resort. We were in a Deluxe room which was in the middle of the building and the room was superb. Even the room amenities & cleanliness were fantastic. There was nothing to complain about at all since we had a superb stay at this place. 

The food was super taste and there were quite a lot food varities were there in the buffet. Food was brilliant and we enjoyed a lot. 

Also the landscape was super amazing since it had lot of space for hanging around and very beautiful locations for photography even. The property was maintained a good standards and thanks to the team who is taken care of the property. Well maintained property. 

Special thanks should goes to IT manager Asanka since thaala hotel is having good WiFi connectivity and most of the rooms were equipped with smart TV üì∫ including Netflix. That was  fantastic. 

Also I should mentioned Hiran & Indunil and the Front team for their positive attitude towards to a smooth operation. A special credit should goes Ms.Sandamali From the spa. She was super friendly and her service was 5 star ‚òÜ + Even all the departments were super good and we has a really wonderful stay at Thaala. 

We hope to see you all again in one day. üòá
title: Fantastic stay at Thaala

roomTip:
Quality and the variety of food should be improved. 
Definitely a good hotel to visit.
text:
Great hotel with excellent service.  This is my second visit to Thaala bentota. What was impressed me is that, on the previous day inquired about my trip by Miss Roche and confirmed my details.  It shows that how they are concern about their guests. Further staff in the Restaurant, specially, Amamdi, Sudesh and Kalindu provided an excellent service. Room is specious and with good facilities. 
But  the variety of food should be improved in order to enhance the standard l suppose. 
All in all a very good experience had with my family.
title: Excellent service

text: Highly recommend Ekho Surf Bentota. Especially their friendly and efficient service. Would like to thank Ms. Kanchana for her friendly service. roomTip: Try to book the 2nd floor. The view is amazing. And take the train to bentota (not aluthgama )... train is the easiest
text: The place is located just next to the Bentota railway station. We like to use Train whenever we travel. So EKHO surf is the best stay in bentota. ownerResponse:
{'id': '973550321', 'text': 'Dear Agent,

Thank you for taking time to post your feedback on behalf of your client. 

It is true that one of other guest (under the influence of alcohol) had come out and urinated to the open area of your client's room in the late night (outside terrace).

However the guest had already finished the job by the time security entered to the scene and security had taken him back apologizing your client and immediately informed the duty manager.

 Rhe duty manager immediately apologized from your client even though it was done by another guest (as he was under the influence of alcohol).

They had washed the entire area with detergent and haven't stopped there. Duty Manager offered a room change as well.
I believe this is the best that we could do at that time. We are not in a position to take legal actions against such behavior of a guest (as your client says).

But we did every possible effort you make your client feel better even though this was not done by one of our hotel staff.

Unfortunately your client was keep on shouting at the lobby this morning saying "I want this to be heard by every possible one of your guests". I still do not understand why he wanted it to be heard by the world.
With great difficulty I somehow managed to tale him to the lounge area and tried to make him understand that this was out of our control, please accept our apologies on behalf of the other guest.

Yet he was arrogantly said "I will post this in every social media" and then he called you up and gave me the phone.

You were fine at the at the beginning but very rude to me then using "F" language. As a reputed Travel Agent you should have never used such abusive language. I had to stop our conversation as I could not bare your language anymore.

I very clearly and confidently state that your client was never abused or harassed, instead we got harassed for something we never committed. And it was a very disappointing discussion and a situation.

However thank you for your feedback and our sincere apology for any inconvenience even though it was not done from the hotel.

Thank you.

Best regards,', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-12', 'responder': 'Kavishka Fernando', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

text:
Without doubt one of the best hotels I stayed in Sri Lanka! Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the staff & since we were travelling as a group the hotel was flexible enough to accommodate rooms ( before the official check in ) for all of our group  the staff was extremely friendly, must give a special thanks to Dulaj ( Asst.Manager) Nimesha & Maleesha (Front Desk) & all the staff for the assistance to get the check in' s without a big hassle. We had planned a gathering & we were able to get the sepetare restaurant of the hotel & it was simply awesome & we all had a great evening there and the restaurant was very flexible ( appreciate this!) and the restaurant supervisors deserve a special thanks, which obviously also added to the experience.Food was good and since we were a group normally you would not get good feedback for the food & lodging.but I'm happy to say it's all thumbs up here.eventhough this is a 4 star hotel to my surprise the atmosphere is so special that it really felt like home to me. All respect for the general manager who does a great job here; A true sample of excellent Sri Lankan hospitality. 

Thank you & looking forward to revisiting Rasika Jayawardene on behalf of Team Trade & Supply Chain Finance of Nations Trust Bank Plc
title: A true sample of excellent Sri Lankan hospitality!

text:
This is a fantastic hotel in a great location, between the river & the beach. The room was really comfortable & spotlessly clean. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, with a special mention to Priyantha De Silva & the restaurant teams who were fantastic. Our son has a severe food allergy & they spent time with us to understand his needs & cater for them. He said his meals were delicious (as were all the meals here) so this was a real plus. 
The art tour, mangrove tour & surfing come highly recommended from our experience & the staff assisting with those are fantastic!
title: Wonderful hotel - made our stay fantastic!

Could not recommend enough

text:
Where does one start? A simply fantastic hotel with absolutely superlative staff.
From the moment we arrived we felt we were really looked after. At first the hotel seemed complex and overwhelming, but after a short while, we became familiar with all it had to offer.
The room itself was a good size with a very comfortable bed and bathroom.
Outside there were various pools and lovely grounds, the beach is literally next door.
Breakfast and dinner are buffet style, with so much variety, you are really spoilt for choice.
A very special mention to all the restaurant staff, as they all were brilliant especially Achala and Udayangani.
title: The best by far

text:
We had the loveliest of holidays at over 3 nights at Bentota Beach by Cinnamon. The weather was not great but cleared up by mid-day to enable us to get out. 
The room service was excellent and although the staff had a lot to do due to one room having 2 small kids, they were always willing and helped us without hesitation. Ruwan and Udaya from House-Keeping were extremely helpful. My thanks to them both.
Restaurant - Janaka and his team including Udayangani and Achala were attentive and helped us no end to enjoy our meals. The food was excellent and we also had dinner one night at the SEA MEATS SPICE restaurant. The setting was lovely and the food tasty and enjoyable. 
One thing that upset me was that it took almost 45 minutes for our luggage to be brought out when we were leaving... it took numerous calls to various staff to get it sorted. 
Overall, the whole stay and experience was very positive and enjoyable.
title: Our stay at the beautiful CinnamonBentota Beach hotel

text:
Excellent hotel with excellent service! We spent 6 days here. The facility is amazing, very large and very clean and has everything you need. Truly a 5 star hotel. Especially to mention Lasan, who took very good care of us during dinner and Anila Rukshan at the beach bar, who was very attentive and helpful during the day. Last but not least, special thanks to Achini, Sajini and Sewandi from the kids club, who took very good care of and entertained our two kids.
The food variety at the buffet is amazing and many goodies prepared live to ones liking (from Sri Lankia over European, Chinese and Indian and other Asian food plus excellent variety at the dessert). Would definitely recommend the hotel.
Since there were some other comments about the high moisture - this is typical for the region and can be handeled easily through room A/C and if needed an additional dehumidifier is provided by the hotel. So all good!
title: Excellent hotel and excellent service

Thank you for your lovely feedback! We‚Äôre delighted to hear that you had a peaceful and luxurious vacation at Cinnamon Bentota Beach.

roomTip: Don‚Äôt buy Coke Zero in the bar - significantly more than ordinary coke.
text:
We had a fabulous stay! Rooms stunning with great cleaning / towels changed etc.  we didn‚Äôt want an evening service ‚Ä¶ but it happened most days anyway. 

Loved the beach - often the only ones using sun loungers in the day.  Sea  quite rough but we were still able to cool off in there. Nice walks along the beaches too. ( it would be nice not to see so much plastic and rubbish - from wash up from sea )

Food totally stunning ü§©‚Ä¶. So much choice and all to a superb standard. We drank the filtered water provided - with no issues.  

All staff lovely - from guest relations team to the security men at the gates. Housekeeping staff often left the most clever towel animals on the bed and the waiting staff in restaurant we very attentive.   

We loved the fact that hotel quieter at this time of the year - even though  we did have some rain the the afternoons at times.  Heavy rain but didn‚Äôt last for long.
title: 5 stars all round ü§©

text:
We had the pleasure of staying at Cinnamon Bentota in September 24. The purpose of the visit was to check out the hotel as it was the chosen venue for my daughter's destination wedding. It was our first visit to this hotel and we were not sure of what to expect. The hotel turned out to be excellent and far exceeded our expectations. A beautiful location with high quality facilities and impeccable service. All facilities were well planned  at the right spots and boasted a truly Sri Lankan experience for our guests. The staff were friendly, professional and efficient at all levels. We found the management cooperative, flexible and collaborative towards the wedding arrangements. Jeevantha, Deshan, Priyantha, Irusha and Sulochana were some of the staff we met to discuss wedding arrangements and Maja who was always checking on us to ensure our stay was enjoyable, They were truly remarkable. We left with confidence and felt assured that Cinnamon Bentota was the right choice and would provide us a memorable wedding experience for our family and friends. Thank You Team for your help and support and look forward to seeing you at the wedding.
Vignesh and Ravini
title: Memorable Stay and Commendable Service

text:
We revisited here after staying here during the summer. The staff continue to be extremely friendly and cater to our every need. Shout outs to the following staff:

Housekeeping:
(who I forgot to review last time, apologies)
Nilaj, Shaatha, Sanath, Amal, Sriyantha as well as those of you who also made our rooms so homely for us, with the extra added touch of the various towel designs for our daughter each day. 

Pool Bar:
Pathiarana- again, recalling our orders and requirements and always being attentive.  

Pool attendants:
Samba, Sampath and Chatu for preparing our beds and making sure we had anything we needed to make our stay comfortable. 

Restaurant:
Dinesh- absolutely amazing, as always, super friendly and knows exactly what we need at any meal sitting. 
Sam- continually fabulous when we see him at breakfast, knowing our every need! 
Sumit-for remembering us after meeting for a short time during our summer stay, being super friendly and helpful. 
Dulanjali- always smiling at breakfast and encouraging us to try new curries;)

As well as all of the other servers who remembered us from last time. 

Chefs:
Rashmi and Dulanjali for being proactive at breakfast for us. For the senior chefs (Dalangi and Bhanuka-I think). And Head Chef Piyush for always being present and friendly and knowing our dietary requirements. 

Room Service:
Apologies for not remembering the names, for the gentleman who answered the phone each night and was fully aware of our needs, and for those who dropped items off in a timely manner. 

Tease Bar:
Sisil and Terrance who are always efficiently serving everyone and to Kushan who was creatively taking care of our daughter for an hour whilst we were there during the day time. 
There are other gentleman who helped us at the start of our stay, from 22nd/23rd October,  whose names I didn't take down. Apologies for this. 

Reception:
The ladies and gentleman whom work at reception and on reception desks, all so friendly, helpful and willing to help. 

Gym/ Activity attendants:
Januka, Chamish and Nerothan for their support at the gym and with children‚Äôs activities. 

MIT ladies (always a pleasure to have a talk to and incredibly hard- working) and MOD gents who were all welcoming and perceptive. 

Finally, to Mr Matthew, the GM who, again, was omnipresent, always smiling, pleasant and made us feel welcome.
.
title: Family friendly, beach holiday, excellent staff, great resort, attentive staff, excellent facilities.

text:
Stunning location overlooking the sea however note there is a railway line behind the hotel which disturbed us in the early hours of the morning. 
The hotel was nice. The staff were all amazing and friendly. 
The room smelt extremely damp &. we had a partial rather than full sea view which we had paid for. The balcony was spacious however there was some building work being carried out. Housekeeping was exceptional, lovely little towel creations every day and serviced the room very well. 
Breakfast was average. Nothing amazing but perfectly acceptable service was excellent. 
We had A La Carte in the all day restaurant - the Sri Lankan and Indian dishes were superb. Twice we ate in The Shack - incredible views, fish and seafood. The waiters really made our experience exceptional - especially Roshan who was so friendly and accommodating and Nuwan, great service. We also ate in the Oriental - food and service excellent but such a lack of atmosphere as we were the only people there, wouldn‚Äôt go back there. 
Spa treatments were ok not the best massage and also felt a bit rushed out. Never been sat up immediately after a massage before! Overall it‚Äôs a nice place to stay would say more 4 star than 5. Loved the food, staff and location.
title: Amazing staff and food

placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
text:
I had a fantastic stay at Taj Bentota, and the resort's stunning location truly enhanced the experience. The breathtaking views complemented an overall enjoyable visit. The dining options were exceptional, with the food exceeding my expectations at nearly every restaurant. A special shoutout to Chef Dalip Singh for his incredible crispy dosa and special masala chai‚Äîhe truly elevated our dining experience! 
Special shoutout for the service at Oriental Pavillion restaurant. They served us a special complementary homemade icecream which was too good. The gentleman at that hotel was very humble.

However, I did face a significant disappointment with the spa services, which is why I am giving a 4-star rating. Unfortunately, the experience was subpar compared to the high standards I typically expect from a 5-star resort. The masseuse appeared to be unwell and continuously coughed throughout the treatment, raising serious hygiene concerns. Additionally, no attention was paid to the focus area that was specified while filling out the form during consultation. The focus areas were simply ignored.

I believe that the Taj management should ensure that staff are fit for service, as this experience detracted from the overall enjoyment of our stay. I hope this feedback helps improve future guest experiences, as I genuinely look forward to returning and enjoying all the wonderful aspects of the resort again.
title: Fantastic Resort

text: A wonderful hotel with simply the most helpful and friendly staff who are always smiling and wanting to offer help. The hotel is not shiny and new but we found this added to its charm. Our room had been refurbished  and the views were beautiful. The gardens are very green and established and looked after with care. The restaurant served a vast array of quality food both at breakfast and dinner. We were wanting to try the Sri Lankan cuisine and were always offered help when choosing. Both Dinesh and Sam were fabulous and we very much enjoyed their helpful and informative conversations. Thanks again for an amazing stay
title: Staff with beautiful smiles together with incredible food in the restaurant

placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
roomTip: wander down to the beach and find the helpful Jimi who offers good value tours and local knowledge
text:
What an amazing place, the hotel is fantastic. The restaurant  was absolutely 5 star with lots of local Sri Lankan foods and international dishes to try.
There are lots of interesting places to visit near by. So much wildlife around the hotel grounds including seeing  a large mongoose, monitor lizards & very tame chipmunks. We loved the large pool that has lots of sun loungers and very helpful waiters.
The staff where brilliant so friendly, they could not do enough for you especially Sampath who looked after us by the pool and Sam in the restaurant who even remembers how you take your morning coffee. We loved the personal touch and genuine friendly staff (which was not fake like in many 5* hotels). The rooms are fully equipped with all you need for your stay and had lovely views. With rooms serviced twice a day, loved the towel animals. Thank you all so much.
title: Best hotel in Sri Lanka !

From the time of arrival to our departure, the staff did an amazing job. The front desk was supportive; even our rooms were upgraded to premium, spacious, and luxurious rooms with a beach view balcony.
The food was with a variety of delicious dishes. Even the al-late cart menu hits differently and was surprised by our tastebuds. This was my second visit to the same place I love the hospitality served which I have got from a few in the country. A special thanks to Mr Chaminda the assi. manager of the Palms restaurant for his warm gestures throughout our stay. The evening snack (sweet plate) was yummy.
Taj Bentota will be one of the best places for great hospitality, service, location and Indian food. Looking forward to a third visit.
title: Amazing and looking forward for a 3rd visit

text:
Initially I was apprehensive booking this property as there are many A listers which are in a row for Bentota location but let me tell you this is by far the best hotel in bentota area with scrumptious food.
We went there as family to spend my birthday, thanks to them they really made my birthday so special with a delicious cake and wonderful decorations
Let me collate the below detailed review 
As soon as we arrived they welcomed us with a sound of shankh and passion fruit drink. 

1. The location is perfect on the beach near to the city and close by u can see railway track 
2. The staff was very good room service was quick no hassle at all 
3. Now let‚Äôs come the food. They have variety of things we ordered pizza on arrival, the pizza was fresh and made right from scratch with fresh base one of the best pizzas I have had. Then we ordered Biryani with less spice for my son but let me tell you even thought the biryani was less specify there was not even a single flavour missing the chicken was soo tender and rice was nicely done special thanks to chef Dalip Singh and chef Malinda 
4. The breakfast menu was elaborate but chef Malinda made sure my son was having what he wanted, they spoiled our kid with different sweets every time I room was setup 
5. They have kids activities every afternoon, on arrival we were treated with a very entertaining magic show. Special thanks to magician Kumar
6. The property itself is soo big we found it hard to cover within two days of our stay

What could be better 

1. The play area for kids had limited options 
2. Even though the breakfast was elaborated menu but one the first day it was hard for us to pick something to eat they can include some continental items as well
title: A stay to remember I am surely coming back to this one. Taj always stands for quality

roomTip:
Please tip for good service. The pool guys work tirelessly. The staff in the Tease bar are so welcoming and make fab Kir Royales !!
The Chef and staff at Shack are amazing.
text:
Everyone has different standards. Somebody might feel that there were no issues to complain about, but that does not mean everything was perfect. There‚Äôs a big difference between good and perfection. Sometimes good is all we are looking for, and sometimes perfect is what we seek.
Let me begin by saying that what makes this hotel so special are the people that work here, so caring,kind, and considerate.
Yes, we had quite a few downfalls, but every issue we had was addressed and put right. This is down to a receptive GM who listened to us and made the changes. I have always found that if you have an issue, raise it and give the hotel a chance to put things right.
Even though I can not rate this hotel with 5 stars, the luxury is missing, and the hotel is worn and tired looking.
Little things such as cushion covers in the main buffet restaurant and pool sunbed covers which have lost their bounce and newness.
I am aware that this is an old hotel, as with older properties, ageing is one of the problems. It needs a face-lift, but this is being done as we speak. Rooms are being refurbished, and the painting and decorating team are hard at it.I have no doubt that in a few years, they will reach their 5 stars. But I feel for the money charged, it is worth what you are paying for. 
I praise the team for all their hard work, their humbleness  and devotion, and I would like to thank you for making our stay so memorable. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: When only 5 stars will do !!

text:
Right from arrival until departure, my better half Pradnya and yours truly, we enjoyed the famous Taj hospitality to the hilt.  It was an amazing and memorable experience.  The Taj Bentota Resort & Spa is located at one of the most picturesque locations, overlooking the sea, in the world.  Having a sea-facing suite made our stay even more rewarding.  The sumptuous spread, both vegeterian and non-vegeterian, at 'The Palms' is just out of this world.  Overall, the Taj Bentota experience is one which we will cherish for the rest of our life.
S Kishore, International Sports Commentator, Mumbai, India.
title: Simply marvellous.

text:
We stayed there three nights. The people there were excellent. They would personally make sure you have the best time. It was the motto of front desk people and managers - "to make our holiday to the fullest"

Problems are everywhere on earth.. in all hotels, but how the team responds and corrects it shows the "five star" status. Any new property can boast about its facilities. I stayed in another brand two day before, lavish property, with simple issue the response of front desk was horrible. they did nothing to help me. however with TAJ- the people made sure even the tiniest issues (not in their hands) - gets the right solution. They were adamant on making our stay the best. WHO IN THE world Does that?... .none of the hotels in west i have seen that kind of hospitality. I am amazed, by the property location, its beauty, the food (chef was amazing, deserves a big big applause, amazing yummy food), the pool, daily activities (magic show was memorable experience for my daughter), menu, safety, beach quality, etc.. i can go on and on. 
My wife and daughter, still praise the hotel and especially all the people there -Amazing north indian chef, Their GM, Mr Mahendra front desk manager, The servers and managers at restaurant, even the lovely cleaners, everyone. I have heartily recomended Taj Bentota to all my contacts as a must for Sri Lanka visit. 

All in all, We had a great memorable stay. The luxury of hospitality comes rare. 
They even packed breakfast for our early morning flight...hatsoff. 

These people did it the best way possible. Everyone is so down to earth, so human. They have my humble gratitude for making it so wonderful for us. 
7 stars. 
splendid indeed.
title: Splendid, Humane, 7 Star Hospitality, Luxury personified.

text: Stayed at Taj Bentota from Sep 13 - Sep15,2024. Wanted to extend for 1 more night. Mr Kishan and other staff at the hotel lobby/reception denied rooms availability and wanted me to check out. placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
text:
My wife and I are staying here for 11 nights. We used TUI as our booking agents. TUI put this hotel down as a 5 star hotel. At best, it's a 4 star. Why!
There are several reasons. Before I start, let me say that once the staff get used to you and you, them they are aways helpful and friendly.
When we first visited Sri Lanka back in 2021, we stayed at the Anantara in Kalutara, now that is a 5 star hotel.
These are our observations of the Taj Bentota:
1. The Spa is drab and dark. You walk from the lobby across to a decking that leads you through trees where you come upon a large fish tank that has seen better days. I'm amazed that the fish in it are still alive. It needs attention. The Spa is just to the left of the fish tank. The services offered are, as far as my wife and I were concerned we're average at best. You feel like they have missed a trick here as there are no creams, oils, or ointment  available to buy. The reception area needs brightening up.
2. We are both in our 60's and did not expect to have to climb into a bath to use a shower. The room was not good, so the following day, we went to reception, explained our concerns, and we were then allocated a different room with a walk in shower which was not available the day before.
This is to the staffs credit that they did this for us for which we are grateful.
3. Food, where to start? For us, the best place to eat was The Shack. It's a fresh fish restaurant and is the best place to eat as you can pick from.the days fresh catch what you want. We both totally recommend this restaurant. 
The Palms is the main restaurant, which everyone uses. It's like a canteen, and you feel like you're being herded in and herded out like  being on a conveyor belt. You also use this place for breakfast. Now I like Eggs Benedict. What I received was not. One of the 2 eggs was not runny, and I have no idea what the sauce was, but it certainly wasn't Hollandaise!
On the 13th, we decided to go to the other restaurant called The Oriental. We arrived at 19:10 to find nobody there, we waited for 10 minutes and then went to reception to ask if the restaurant is open? They made a few phone calls and then we were escorted back down to the restaurant. We sat down and eventually we had another really nice meal, but, only 1 person was there serving due to a function taking place adjacent to the restaurant, Why!
4. While the pool area is clean, well maintained and very good you cannot help but think if this place had full occupancy then there would not be enough room for everyone, yes the beach is about  50 yards away but not everyone likes the beach. For me, they need another pool, they have the room.
I think TUI need to look at their grading system as this is not a 5 star hotel. Room for improvement by all concerned.
title: Room For Improvement

placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
text:
First part is the hotel and the second part is Sri Lanka in general.

First Part: Hotel
This was our first time to Sri Lanka so we went with India's most trusted brand..the 'Taj' group of hotels. When we arrived we felt that the room was a bit small and 'slightly' dull interiors, smallish bathroom and a really small tub. This was the deluxe room category. Feeling slightly let down, we requested for a change to a Junior Suite and that was much more the 'Taj' standard that we expect. The duty manager 'Krishnan' was very helpful on this. Mind you if the deluxe room was what we have come to expect of Taj, we might have not required the shift to the suite at nearly twice the price! That's why I have cut a star from my rating. But apart from that, the hotel is a Taj..great location, walking distance from the beach. Special thanks to a couple of more people..Manchanayaka at 'The Shack '. Great seafood with a set menu...fine dining standards with generous portions. Another one 'Sam' at 'The Palms' which is the all day restaurant and breakfast restaurant. Fabulous service..special attention for my 11 year old son. General complaint with all hotels that I have these days...what's the problem with providing phone casting on TVs? Everyone watches online content these days and if you want to be in pace with the times, please provide smart TVs that allow phone content casting to TV! Overall satisfied with the hotel, we might come again (when and if the room interiors undergo an upgrade)

Second Part: Sri Lanka
Seriously..why did it take us so long to consider this hidden gem for a visit. Why does it come so far down the list after Maldives, Thailand, Indonesia etc. The general impression of this country is so flawed. Pristine beaches, extremely nice people, spot less and clean beaches (at least in the south), no constant haggling of customers (controlled commercialization), Europe quality expressways, not a single pothole and pretty modern populace. Fix the impression guys and become a top tourist destination (though not sure if peak season has more 'noise' , for the record we went in August). You have everything and more than other tourist hotspots! There are the usual undercurrents of religious bias, probable kickbacks and fixed restaurants, gem stores, shopping etc. that your tourist guide will take you to. First must do is the Madu river safari..you visit some great spots, a fish spa, a cinomon farm, spot some nice water birds and a place which has a baby aligator that you can hold. Second must do is the turtle hatchery, release some baby turtles into the sea. Third must do is para gliding..the pilot was an experienced brazilian.

Give SriLanka a chance guys. I am sure you won't regret it.
title: A forgotten gem in the Indian Ocean

The cocktails were also lovely and we enjoyed a game of pool which was fun! 
The only thing we would change is staying for a bit longer!! 1 night is not at all enough. 
Thanks for an amazing stay!

placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
roomTip: Try for a room at the higher floors
text:
First of all, Sri Lanka is GORGEOUS! Taj Bentota increases the allure of this place with it's location, views, and the scrumptious food. 
Location is 5 stars or more if that was an option. With 3 entry and exit points to the beach right from the resort you're always literally at a stone's throw from the sea. 
Service from all the staff is quick and unfailing.
We had read a lot of reviews about the food and they were not exaggerated.  The Lankan dishes in the buffet are definitely worth a try and might leave you pleasantly surprised if you haven't had Lankan food earlier. The only thing I didn't care for in terms of food was the barbecue on the weekend. For my Indian palate, the plain and bland style of marination just didn't work. Maybe they could try an Indian Tandoor Barbecue spread sometime. 
A walk around the property might give you a chance to meet the Friends of Bentota - 3 cute ducks, a couple of colorful birds (not sure about the species), a waddling land monitor and some very pretty and colorful plants in the resort nursery. The staff will proudly explain about the plants to you.
Once you're here you will of course do the touristy things but do also try to bake in a walk around the quaint railway station and the village pond. Shopping is best done in the local market here. You'll get everything that you might look for in the boutique shops of Galle. 
There's a certain something about the vibe that will stay with you long after you've left.
title: Gorgeous, Heavenly

placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
roomTip: Select the rooms from the 400 and above or any room away from the construction area.
text:
Didn't expect those sweets.

We wanted to stay at a great hotel away from Colombo over the weekend, while going through the places down south we found this place and let me tell you it justified the price. 

A very hospitable  environment with everyone from the reception to the room service, they made sure that our stay was one that we have not experienced before and by the experience that they had given us it's safe to say that they did a good job in doing so. 

One of the more intriguing things that happened at the stay were the complimentary food that they gave. They started of with a fruit platter and then an hour later a sweet platter which was unexpected but tasted great.

The food was amazing with having a variety of Indian cuisines with a few Sri Lankan ones as well. Also since the hotel is located close to the ocean they had quite a few BBQ s of seafood.

One issue i did face was the during breakfast time when i went to get a coffee, the machine was broken and they said that they will bring me one to my table. I waited through the entire breakfast but never received that coffee. Then i got up and found that coffee machine was closed and they had brought out containers with coffee that could be self served.

I should also thank the security team for helping out in an injury I had faced.
title: A little suprise

placeInfo: {'id': '306383', 'name': 'Taj Bentota Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4119, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.416564, 'longitude': 79.997154, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306383-Reviews-Taj_Bentota_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tajhotels.com/en-in/taj/taj-bentota-sri-lanka/?utm_source=Google&utm_campaign=Bentota-Sri-Lanka&utm_medium=Local', 'address': 'National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'National Holiday Resort', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 102, 'count2': 130, 'count3': 363, 'count4': 974, 'count5': 2550}}
text:
Taj must be the best hotel in the Bentota area. We stayed here as a family of 5 for 10 days. As a family of 5, we needed 2 rooms as I don‚Äôt believe they have rooms to accommodate more than 4x people. However they gave us adjacent (not interconnecting) rooms which was fine. We were lucky enough to have rooms on the 6th Floor with stunning views across the gardens and to the ocean. Hotel and rooms are well maintained and the staff were all friendly and professional (special thanks to Milton). 

One of the best features of the hotel is the mixture of pool and beach. The pool area was really relaxed and plenty of space for swimming and lounging. There is direct access to the beach. The quality of the sand is excellent, great for walking or kids playing. Even though it was the tail end of monsoon, we found the waters to be safe for swimming and there was a patrolled area only a couple of hundred meters up the beach.

This is a quality hotel both in terms of infrastructure, service and staff. The building and the grounds retain a connection with it‚Äôs environment rather than the site being over-developed. We loved the fact that for almost every area of the hotel, there is a visual connection with the ocean and the lush green surrounds. It immediately puts your mind and mood into ‚Äòtropical holiday mode‚Äô.

Quality of the food at breakfast, lunch and dinner was very very good. For lunch and dinner in the main restaurant, you can opt for either al la carte or buffet. Whatever your choice, you will get a high-quality feed. The range of curries and other local dishes were particularly good. We stayed for 10 days and the breakfast offering, whilst very good and diverse, could be improved with some periodic variation as it was exactly the same each morning.

A couple of extra tips for those considering booking. Note, these are not directly affiliated with Taj but may be helpful if you end up staying here:

1)	Surfing Lessons from ‚ÄòLong Surf School‚Äô were exceptional. Both the parents and our 3 children (11, 8,7) tried this on three separate occasions it was that good. Great fun, great instructors, good equipment. This was a highlight. They are located literally at the entry between the Taj and the beach. Contact the owner Amila (+94 77 600 0869)
2)	There are a range of really good restaurants just outside the main gate of the Hotel. All serve fantastic local dishes, seafood and some western options. Really cost effective, good ambience, we had absolutely no issue with food safety/quality. Some highlights included Rana Seafood and Tracks. Pier 88 was also another good option in town (great steak, great views, potent cocktails!!)
3)	On our first day, we needed a Tuk Tuk to get to town (you could easily walk but young kids and high humidity do not correlate well!) By chance, we chose Ranga and we used him for all of our Tuk Tuk rides for the remainder of our trip. Fantastic guy, really safe driver, really helpful when we needed good recommendations for groceries, laundry, tailors etc. Absolutely recommend you contact Ranga (+94 77 6504118) 
4)	For tours and airport transfers, we used Dumindu (+94 77 646 4820). Dumi drove us to Galle. He was a great driver and really knowledgeable about the local area and Galle. Great guy and his van had seatbelts. We found Dumi‚Äôs services to be better than the original airport transfer arranged by the hotel.
5)	For water sports, we used Diyakawa. They had good quality life jackets, boats and equipment. Really fun and well priced.
title: Family Resort Review + Tips for Bentota Activities

text:
Situated in a calming beautiful location. Absolutely loved the room and the whole hotel. We were offered complimentary 15mins of foot massage at their spa. The masseuse was incredible, that we opted for a full massage. One of the best properties of Jetwing.

The only downside if their food. Their menu does not offer much variety, and portion sizes were alright (would not be sufficient for some adults). The food could taste better. Food was a huge negative here.

Would definitely visit again if food was better.
title: Great stay disappointing meals.

text: Couldn't recommend enough! My wife and I booked a room last minute due to a sudden change in our plans. Despite this, the staff welcomed us warmly, even going through the trouble of arranging dinner for us. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and highly understanding. With a ton of greenery inside and being right next to the beach, the location was superb! And the food was amazing! The menu presented was delicious in every way! A huge thanks to our butler Mr Prabath, who was a massive help throughout our stay. A highly recommended destination! 5/5.
title: Jetwing Saman Villas Stay

roomTip: Best idea would be the half board - to get the breakfast ( which is sooooo extensive, it will fill one till lunch time ) and the dinner.
text:
We went for our honeymoon based upon a friends recommendation. The property is breathtakingly beautiful, perched on a cliff with their own access to a peaceful clean beach. The vibes are quite, very private. The food is sumptuous and very fine dine. The in house  spa is also good. The rooms are built very comfortably with stunning architecture. One doesn't feel they are part of a hotel property honestly because the make is such- there is grass all round the property and sea views to die for ! 
Especial shout out to Mr Prabhat - our personal butler who assisted to us in all our needs and made it a memorable stay. 
We couldn't have asked for a better honeymoon experience.
title: Idyllic luxurious honeymoon

placeInfo: {'id': '306376', 'name': 'Jetwing Saman Villas', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1420, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.395348, 'longitude': 80.00513, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306376-Reviews-Jetwing_Saman_Villas-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsamanvillas/', 'address': 'Galle Road, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 42, 'count4': 142, 'count5': 1211}}
roomTip: Try as many dishes and local barman's cocktails as possible; as every dish and drink delivers!
text:
Jetwing Saman Villas tops the list on the Best Places to Relax in Sri Lanka with impeccable food, service and ambience.

Kisali Mirando and her team ensured that every single need was catered to, with every member of staff going the extra mile to make our stay as memorable as possible. We appreciate the personal touch we received extending from upper management to all the staff who took time out to regularly speak to us and ensure that all our requirements were being fulfilled.

We must highlight the exceptional service provided by Eranga Madushanka, our designated butler for the stay, who was courteous throughout and always made sure that our rooms and food/drink requirements were up to the standard. He regularly checked in to see if we wanted anything else and was always keen to make sure that we were happy with everything.

We must also highlight the remarkable concoctions created by the Head Barman, Jayasiri Silva. His use of local ingredients to create the most unique cocktails is absolutely amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed trying every drink he proudly served.

The food was divine with the perfect balance of local and international cuisine, giving us a series of options. The chefs delivered an elevated dining experience as every dish was made to perfection and certainly some of our favourite meals.

Saman Villas has topped our travel list in Sri Lanka and has become a go to every holiday to experience tranquillity and comfort. 

Thank you very much to the team for ensuring our stay was remarkable.
title: The BEST Place to Relax in Sri Lanka! Food, Service and Ambience at its finest!

text:
Saman Villas was one of our honeymoon hotels, and it proved to be the perfect place to relax and enjoy our special time. The serene atmosphere and breathtaking views, especially from the infinity pool overlooking the beach, made our stay unforgettable.

From the moment we arrived, the warm welcome with garlands and a special honeymoon cake set the tone for our stay. The service was excellent, and having a butler who was both helpful and nice added a personal touch. Our room was very spacious, and the large bathroom with a bathtub was a luxury.

The food at Saman Villas was delicious, and the presentation of dishes like the kottu, served like godamba rolls stuffed with chicken, was impressive. Additionally, the 15-minute complimentary foot massage and the personalized card with our photo were sweet gestures that made our stay even more special.

Thank you, Saman Villas, for making our honeymoon an unforgettable experience.
title: An unforgettable honeymoon at Saman Villas

text:
One of the best honeymoon destinations to have placed seeing the waves of the sea. Absolutely amazing experience from the 1st step till we left from the serenity. From the welcome to the room guide it was such a pleasant experience. 
What an amazing and very very specious villa they have as it had the exact privacy you need to have your comfortability. The view from the bedroom to see the amazing view of the waving sea is something we never expected from a sea view hotel. The butler assigned made it really comfortable to have maintained it professionally during our entire stay. 
The food taste was so delicious in each meal we had. They were extremely careful to provide us with the best food taste for our selection. The complementary cakes and other sweet items  were so mouth-watering. 
The SPA was the best in town - what a soothing area with amazing vibrant. Treated us so well.
title: Best sea view ever experienced

text:
Great experience staying at Jetwing Saman Villas. Amazing rooms will plunge pools. Very quiet and peaceful. Nearby beaches that are walking distance and very quiet. Food options were amazing for vegetarians. Spa was good, with a good range of massages and therapies available.
Just to note; Plunge pools are not 100% private as the adjoining villa is upstairs and they can look over you in your ground floor plunge pool villa.
Special thanks to Chanuka and Sanath (our butler) for taking care of us as well as all the other staff there.
title: Great experience staying at Jetwing Saman Villas

text:
Jetwing Saman Villas was a very impressive  experience from  breathtaking location , perched atop a hill overlooking the horizon into the ocean, providing stunning panoramic views. 

We were welcomed by Lakmal on Arrival and showed to our villas and given a thorough tour of the Villa. 

The villa itself was spacious, Elegant & Aesthetically furnished with high end interior and offered with amenities for a comfortable stay.

roomTip: I suggest you book direct through Jetwing Travels their sister company, rather than an online or hightstreet agent.
text:
Even before we arrived I knew that this would be an exceptional experience . I can unequivocally say that, after three visits to Srl Lanka, this hotel experience stands out. The service throughout was very professional, very courteous and friendly. This can be attributed to the training of the personnel and the leadership from Wester, the General Manager.Everybody from Kisali, the assistant, to the Executive Chef, the restaurant manager to our butler. All were very engaging and wanting to do more for us.

The situation of the resort on a headland cliff jutting out between two very lengthy sandy beaches is unique. As the sunset over the horizon , we sat sipping cocktails and were very happy to have selected Saman Villas as our final stop of our two week trip. 
The rooms were very spacious with a modern well equipped bathroom and a covered balcony. The rooms have recently been given an update with new lighting controls and the air conditioning was silent

 . The room beneath us had a dip pool, but that was no loss to us as the main pool perched above the cliff was of good size and never crowded 
As for the food, the menu was extensive, featuring both Sri Lankan  and western .
Prepared to order, the food was delicious and well presented.  Breakfast was from an a la carte menu rather than a buffet . A good management decision appropriate for a luxury property.

As a retired hotelier myself,I can certainly confirm that Jetwing Hotels deserves the recognition as Sri Lanka's leading hotel group. I would not hesitate to stay at Saman Villas or any of their other properties around the country.
title: Outstanding and memorable experience

placeInfo: {'id': '306376', 'name': 'Jetwing Saman Villas', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1420, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.395348, 'longitude': 80.00513, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d306376-Reviews-Jetwing_Saman_Villas-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsamanvillas/', 'address': 'Galle Road, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 42, 'count4': 142, 'count5': 1211}}
text:
My wife and I have stayed at some hundreds of hotels over the last 60 years, and we are both hard-pressed to name a more enjoyable facility.

Set high up on a bluff, villas are spread out from the main building in two wings with half facing the sandy beach to the north and half facing the sandy beach to the south. There was a sense of peace and calm throughout the hotel. Maybe it wasn‚Äôt fully-occupied, or it could be that people ate at different times.

Although attracted to the sparkling, clear water of the large communal swimming pool, we were fortunate enough to have booked one of the villas with a private pool. Depending upon how hot we felt, we could rotate between shaded sun-lounger, covered patio, or air-conditioned inside lounge.

We booked the very reasonable half-board which offered various Asian and Western dining options. In a land that‚Äôs capable of serving up delicious meals, these were amongst the best that we had experienced in the previous two weeks.

The delightful staff really made the hotel stand out. Unfailingly polite, we were greeted on every contact irrespective of their role. After a free fifteen-minute foot massage, my wife managed to fit in six spa treatments over three days so managed to strike up quite a relationship with the masseuse.

In a country that is cricket-mad, you only had to mention the magic word and the conversation picked up a pace. Sudath, our ‚Äúpersonal butler‚Äù, was a treasure. He attended to the room, served each meal, and was overwhelmed with joy after each Sri Lankan victory. Although we didn‚Äôt test his drink-making ability, he was certainly an expert at making animal shapes with towels.

As a thoughtful, parting gesture, we were presented with a framed photo of the two of us which is on display back home.
 
Well done to Wester, the general manager, and all his staff.
title: A delightful gem to complete our Sri Lankan holiday

roomTip: Sometimes not enough chairs by the infinity pool and butler mobile phone signal erratic - had to call service number
text:
We started our Sri Lanka holiday here and it still hasn‚Äôt been beaten for views location and customer service! One of our Sri Lankan friends in UK recommended this chain of hotels and it appealed because adult only.
Rent one of the detached villa suites with 2 floors if your budget allows.Check the direction of the sun though - our private pool was in the shade much of the day so hardly used.
 Due to the jet lag we never made breakfast but the delicious all day fresh food was a perfect solution. We ate in the restaurant each night and had a personal butler Oshini who was incredible. Nothing was too much trouble and her gentle smiling efficient service was a highlight of the stay. Also recommend Manori in the Spa who have several outstanding massage treatments in the open air Spa. Other hotels in the South have lost their authentic feel due to being taken over by Russian investors and guests. Bentota and this JetWing hotel seems to have retained their charm
title: Romantic, peaceful hotel with stunning location

roomTip: Saman Villa is such a beautiful place to relax and unwind I recommend that you stay a minimum of two to three days!!
text: We had a family reunion and we booked 5 rooms and the rooms were large and spacious and very comfortable. On checking in we were given a local phone and a card with the name of our personal butler! We could call the butler if we needed anything at all and within minutes he would show up with our request. The swimming pool was amazing and again the service was fantastic. We requested that we would like to have tea by the pool and promptly tables were setup and tea and butter cake was served. Since we wanted to swim in the ocean a lifeguard was sent to watch over our safety from the minute we went into the water till we got out he was there to make sure that we were safe. We stayed there for two nights and everyday we used to look forward to viewing the set menu which was delicious on both days!! Since I wanted to watch the Superbowl through my laptop computer I needed a USB cable and the gentleman from engineering brought a new cable and installed it and made sure everything was working. The manager was hands on and paid attention to detail and his staff were well trained and went above and beyond to make sure that we were well looked after. Everywhere we walked on the property we were greeted by friendly staff who stopped and made the effort to make us feel welcome. We will definitely return to Saman Villa!!
title: Saman Villa exceeded our expectations!!

text: We stayed at Jetwing Saman Villas for 5 nights - room 23. Our villa was fantastic. We had a beautiful indoor/outdoor bathroom, dressing area, huge bed, living room and outdoor space with private pool and a butler.  The views from our swimming pool were spectacular.  We were on half board basis and the food was superb ‚Äì our breakfast was absolutely delicious as were the evening meals, every night we had a different menu to choose from and the cookery was brilliant.  The only thing that let this hotel down was that there was nowhere to go and enjoy a post dinner drink, enjoy the views etc as the bar area was really nonexistence. Given that the rest of the hotel was fabulous, the bar area should be somewhere enticing for a bit of people watching and relaxing. Instead we went back to our room and watched Netflix !    We also found that the drinks were ridiculously overpriced. Now to our Butler ‚Äì Oshini ‚Äì she was just brilliant, caring, kind and very funny and she was only 18 years old ‚Äì such an asset to the hotel and I hope that they realise this.  We were really sorry to have missed her when we went but she must have been busy with her other guests. Oshini you were a delight to know and you will go far in your career. We wish you all the best for your future.
title: Stunning Hotel and location

text:
We finished our two week stay in Sri Lanka with 3 nights at this wonderful, spacious and romantic hotel. It was a fabulous conclusion with its stunning location on a rocky outcrop above two long sandy beaches.

We had an upper floor room with a balcony giving fantastic west facing ocean views. It was only a short walk to the restaurant, bar and pool but was privately situated.

Our charming young butler (Eranga) looked after us very well and our room was spotless. He also served us in the restaurant, where breakfast and other meals were quite superb. Our special Valentines dinner was imaginatively created and beautifully served - a real treat! The food and drink was more expensive than other hotels we‚Äôve stayed at this time, but were of exceptional quality and with excellent service in a lovely ambience.

The enormous infinity pool had gorgeous views over the sea and beaches (NB best to use the metal ladders to get in rather than the horribly slippy shallow steps üò≥!) and was carefully attended by a friendly lifeguard.

Lovely spa too - the complimentary foot massage was most welcome and thoroughly enjoyable!

Overall, a wonderful hotel - very well overseen by Wester and his team, and we would love to return another year.
title: Beautiful hotel with Genuine 5* Service

We just returned from our honeymoon at Hotel Pandanus, and it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment we arrived, the friendly staff made us feel special and welcomed. Their attentiveness truly enhanced our stay.

The food was a standout feature‚Äîdelicious and beautifully presented. The chef is incredibly talented, creating dishes that delighted our taste buds. While the morning buffet was good, we felt it could benefit from a bit more variety to make it even more impressive.

Our spacious deluxe room was perfect for a romantic getaway. It was well-appointed with all the amenities we could ask for, providing a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere.

We appreciated that the hotel is fair to both locals and foreigners, fostering a welcoming environment for everyone. Overall, our stay at Hotel Pandanus was a wonderful way to celebrate our honeymoon, and we can't recommend it highly enough!
title: A Perfect Honeymoon Escape at Hotel Pandanus!

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
roomTip: Stay altleast for two nights if not more
text:
Pandanus Beach Resort was an unexpected gem on our Sri Lanka trip. Set in a fantastic location just 10 minutes from Bentota Beach, it offers a more secluded and exclusive experience on its adjacent beach, away from the busier tourist areas. The sea-facing rooms boast breathtaking ocean views, perfect for capturing stunning sunsets that will stay with you long after your visit. You can also soak in the sunset from the resort‚Äôs beautiful pool, which sits right off the beach, blending seamlessly with the ocean horizon.

The hospitality at Pandanus is exceptional, with a friendly and attentive team at the reception who go out of their way to make you feel welcome. For those looking for an extra touch of luxury, some rooms feature private jacuzzis. The breakfast spread is extensive and varied, with the staff putting in tremendous effort to ensure we felt right at home.

I found Pandanus a more appealing choice than staying directly in Bentota, as it offers a peaceful, serene atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for relaxation. If you plan to visit Bentota frequently, I‚Äôd suggest renting a scooter for easy access or taking a tuk-tuk, which costs around 400 LKR. The beach itself is ideal for morning jogs and, during low tide, can be safe for swimming.

In short, Pandanus Beach Resort offers great hospitality, unforgettable views, and a tranquil ambiance, making it a standout choice. Excellent management from breakfast service to front desk‚Äîhighly recommended for a restful and scenic getaway.
title: Exceptional Hospitality, great sunset.

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
text: Excellent standards throughout at this resort and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional highlighted by making my birthday such a special day. I hadn't mentioned to anyone that my birthday was during my stay, I presume they check passports for such events. Not only was my bed decorated with a birthday message, flowers and a towel elephant but our dining table was also decorated in the same manner and I was presented with a birthday cake as the catering staff, accompanied by a saxophonist, sang happy birthday to me. All so unexpected and very much appreciated. I can't praise all the staff highly enough for their help, friendliness and efficiency throughout our stay - especially  Ananda, Head of House, who quite clearly took great pleasure making sure everything ran smoothly and efficiently for all guests.                   There is only one thing that could be improved and it is nothing to do with the hotel. The hotel beach area was kept very clean but the areas of the  beach either side were littered with debris washed in from the sea which nobody cleared away. Plastic items of all kinds, glass bottles, flip flops and various other objects were strewn across the beach. Some items were quite sharp making it dangerous to walk on these stretches of beach. I did mention this, as did other guests, so hopefully it will be addressed.
title: An excellent holiday experience

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
text:
Great room on the lower level by the pool, great selection of food, ate at the pool side a couple of times too and was worth the extra money.
The swimming pool is amazing, so clean and refreshing, don‚Äôt let the green tiles put you off!
Bar selection was limited on all inclusive and wine was pretty expensive. Draft beer was good though and always nice and cold.
Rooftop bar was only open 1 of the nights we were there, and no draft beer up there. Other than that the hotel is very quiet in the evenings.
Bar and restaurant staff were all great, but it‚Äôs a shame they don‚Äôt have name badges on as it would help the guests connect with staff more easily (as there are tons of wonderful staff so too many names to remember!). Special thanks to Adid, Malan, Manoj, Kalum, Sumudu and Buddika for always going above and beyond and looking after us all.
title: Lovely, well maintained, quiet hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
text:
We just came off of a one-night stay at Pandanus Beach Resort and overall it was fine. Like most hotels in Sri Lanka, the staff were so kind, friendly, and it was genuine hospitality. 

The key driver in my 'average' rating of this hotel is just the facilities. It has SO much potential being right on the beach, but walking in it just felt tired and outdated. 

Furniture is old and in need of a refresh in the lobby, and while our room (306) was largely fine, the furniture in there was also tired, stained, and subpar. The shower had noticeable rust around the door, and the hallway leading to the room is dimly let, and kind of dingy. 

The restaurant is ok - we dined a la carte for lunch, and had the buffet for dinner. Note: this hotel has an all-inclusive option, which seems to be what most guests here opt for so dinner was an absolute mess of people all trying to get food at the same time and the poor staff tried very hard to keep up with the pace of food and drink orders. 

This property caters to a very specific type of clientele, and I suppose if you want to do this for 5-7 nights or longer at an all-inclusive in Sri Lanka, you may choose Pandanus. We were only here one night before an early drive the next morning to the airport, so it served our needs, but would only have been acceptable to me for one-night. Definitely a 3* property, but with potential to be better with some investment and refreshing.
title: Staff Are Great | Facilities are Run Down

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
text:
I had a wonderful stay at Pandanus Hotel! The atmosphere was warm and welcoming from the moment I arrived. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and perfect for a relaxing getaway. Every staff member was friendly and went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed.

The food was a real highlight‚Äîwhether you're enjoying local Sri Lankan dishes or something more familiar, the flavors were fantastic, with plenty of variety to choose from.

One of the best parts is that the hotel is just an hour and a half away from Colombo, making it super convenient for a quick escape. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for both tourists and locals to unwind and enjoy some peace while still being close to key attractions. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Sri Lanka!
title: Perfect Getaway Just 1.5 Hours from Colombo ‚Äì A Relaxing Stay at Pandanus Hotel!

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
roomTip: The hotel IS nice, but there are plus and minus that you must know. The location IS no good and It can be boring to be there if It rains
text:
The hotel IS nice, but there are plus and minus that you must know.

+Plus

Very polite and attentive personal. you ask for something and they help you quickly. Special nice service from the 6 guys Who clean the rooms plus deshan and dilip in the restaurant

All.rooms with see view

Very clean hotel

Music in the night

The food IS nice

- Minus

Not well located hotel in the middle of a local avenue. There IS almost nothing around. If you wanna have fun you must take a taxi or a tuktuk

No diet soda. Diet IS pa√≠d even if you have all inclusive

Animation during the day IS not enough considering that there IS nothing to do around the hotel...1 session of Acqua gym un Morning and voleyball in the afternoon if It does not rain. If It rains, you Will be very bored

Basically, I liked this hotel but when I return to Sri Lanka, i Will choose another one at a place where there are more things to do, for example Galle and not a hotel at the middle of nowhere like this one, because its very restrictive

I give 4 stars any way

For taxi services (Man and the van)i used the services of hemantha and Mr rohit Who IS my fab driver(very responsive man) WhatsApp +94776170861

For guide and safari services at Udawalule i recommend susantha WhatsApp +94742356380 ..its much cheaper to buy with local guide then with your tour operator, believe me..

Dilip the Guy in the restaurant of hotel make very beautiful art on tables with raw rice (beautiful letters with Colour rice). I think its a good idea to Contact him if you need something special in your table during event). His insta IS @madushandilip This IS my idea to comment, dilip did not tell me to do this at all
title: 4 star with comments

text:
Our stay at the Pandanus Hotel exceeded our expectations. The experience was incredibly enjoyable thanks to the extremely friendly and very helpful staff. A big thank you to the wonderful reception staff, housekeeping service, and the exceptional restaurant team. Special thanks to Charaka, Dilip, Manoj, Isuru, and the entire team. Our goodbye dinner was lovely. 

We were impressed by the attention to detail and the warm hospitality we received throughout our stay. Every request was met with a smile, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. The dedication and professionalism displayed by everyone made our stay truly memorable.

Additionally, I would like to extend a special thank you to the pool guy who found my ring in the sand on the beach. I was sure that I had lost it, but he found it, and it was nothing short of a miracle. We can't wait to return and experience the exceptional service once again.
title: Amazing hotel and excellent service

roomTip: We are out of season - which is lovely
text:
We are here in the monsoon season. The sea is to rough to swim. However, you can get over it! We have had rain over night and a couple of 15 min down pours. But it's to warm to worry. Unlike some Asian tourist hot spots, Sri Lanka is clean, stunningly beautiful and they drive on the left! The people are welcoming and warm.
We travelled with Mercury again as we think we have found some of the loveliest boutique hotels around the Indian ocean with them. So we are adding another......Pandanus beach resort and spa. 
I am writing this while eating lunch of prawns, pork, bbq chicken and salad. Isuru and Deshan taking care of us. As a small hotel, quieter at this time of year, the buffet is smaller to reduce waste which is good to see.   The chef will accommodate whatever you need and the choice of veg and fruit is great. FYI wine is extra but the beer and local spirits mean you don't miss it. (wine is a little expensive in Sri Lanka generally).
The location is literally on the beach and the sound of breaking waves your constant backdrop. Our room is stunning and there is a 40m pool that is warmed by the sun. 
So if the idea of Asia intimidates you a little, come here first. I simple can't say enough good things about this beautiful hotel. Check out the pics. I am not exaggerating! 
Even the guys selling tours on the beach are polite and no issue. They aren't pushy and probs have a great prices?
title: Perfect Pandanus Beach Resort
