placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
text:
Pandanus beach was absolutely beautiful. 
We have travelled to some beautiful places but honestly the staff in this hotel were by far the best we‚Äôve stayed with. 
From the moment you arrive they welcome you, they are so happy to have you stay with them. 
We felt like we‚Äôd known them for ever and they were like good friends. 
Extra special thanks to Hirun, Vishwa, Dilha and Chartoo. ( apologies if they are spelt wrong) you guys went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. 

All the reception staff were lovey. They even gave us a free upgrade to a deluxe room with breathtaking views. 

The food was delicious and it was so lovely to see the chefs in the restaurant and be able to talk to them. 
They even made us special dishes on 2 occasions. 
The variety of food was 5* always freshly cooked and plentiful. The flavours were delicious. Always a meat dish, chicken, sea food, pasta different dishes every setting. The flavours were incredible.

The pool was lovely, the pool boys would put your towels out every morning. Comfy cushioned sun beds lots to choose from in the sun or under the trees for some shade. 
Unfortunately the sea was too rough for us to swim. We did try one morning when it looked calmer but it threw us about like rag dolls. Those waves are incredibly powerful. Once, was enough!!

We did hire a driver and he took us to some beautiful calm beaches for the day.

There are a few beach restaurants along the beach but honestly the food was so so good in hotel we only we ate out a few times. 

The rooms are spotless and are very comfortable. 
The upgrade was just perfect, the jacuzzi, the huge balcony that you stepped down to leaving the entire glass front of the room with full view of the ocean, waking up to that view was just amazing. Thank you so much for offering us the upgrade such a wonderful thing to do. 

We did some wonderful trips with our driver and guide. He booked them all, overnight safari stay, river safari, jungle beach, turtle sanctuary, tsunami museum, Kandy, Galle fort to name a few, he recommended and took us wherever we wanted to go. 

We fell in love with Sri Lanka. 
It truly is the most beautiful place with most humble incredible people. 

We felt really sad saying good bye to you all especially after the beautiful table to say goodbye and our leaving dinner. 
I still can‚Äôt believe you did all that for us. 

Thank you so much for your wonderful hospitality. 
Would we return‚Ä¶.. absolutely!!

See again soon Pandanus beach.
title: Absolutely perfect, did not want to leave.

placeInfo: {'id': '611903', 'name': 'Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1300, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.37973, 'longitude': 80.00978, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d611903-Reviews-Pandanus_Beach_Resort_Spa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.pandanusbeach.com', 'address': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Colombo - Galle Main Rd', 'street2': 'Yalegama', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80510'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 45, 'count2': 45, 'count3': 119, 'count4': 333, 'count5': 759}}
text:
We did a cultural tour of Sri Lanka before arriving at the Pandanus Hotel for 5 days relaxation. It was absolutely perfect in every way. Out of all of the 8 hotels across Sri Lanka that we stayed in, this one was the best. 1. The staff cannot do enough for you and we‚Äôre so responsive to every need.. 2 the food was exceptional and even when there was something I wanted for breakfast that was not there, they not only cooked it for me but served it to me every morning without even me asking. 3 The hotel was so clean throughout and our room met all of our needs and despite there being no bathrobes , we requested them and they were there in minutes. 4. The sunsets each evening on the terrace were just outstanding . 
We would also like to recommend the tuk tuk driver who came for us everyday, took us to anywhere we wanted, was incredibly safe and a real gentleman. His details are Nihal Tours +94 (0) 916 8996.

We will certainly be going back for more R&R next year
title: The best Sri Lankan experience throughout out stay

text: Our stay at Pandanus Beach resort was very nice! The staff were great, polite and very helpful, as was the room service. One employee named Amila particularly stood out to us. As soon as we entered the pool area, we were immediately given towels and assigned suitable loungers. The food was very tasty if you like Asian food. You have to be open to new things. However, there was actually something to suit your taste every day. The only negative point is the people on the beach and on the loungers who approached you and tried to sell you things, but the hotel has nothing to do with that. All in all, it was a very nice stay and we would love to come back.
title: Wonderful stay

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
roomTip: Enjoy a pot of Ceylon tea on your terrace.
text:
Couldn‚Äôt fault this place. Clean, comfortable with beautiful surroundings. Villas were spacious with big bathrooms and large balcony. We loved watching the wildlife, monkeys, birds etc. The pool was so pretty and relaxing. We all had lovely massages where you could hear the peacocks and birdsong in the background. Pots of tea/coffee whenever you wanted.
Loved getting the tuk tuks to different restaurants but the best food we had by far was at the Shangri Lanka restaurant. Amazing chef! All the staff so friendly and helpful. Rohan and Karen helped organise a driver,Manjula, for our trip to Shangrilanka village. He was really friendly and helpful, stopping at roadside stalls for a taste of the local food.Felt very safe being driven around . Shangrilanka Village also beautiful and peaceful with so many birds. Thankyou and hope to be back! We miss Mario!
title: Peaceful paradise

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
roomTip: Be prepared to chill.
text: Return visit to a great little chillout hotel. Surrounded by greenery and smiling faces it provides really good food , small swimming pool and cold beer at reasonable prices. Great team effort. Local tuk tuk  to town and further tours available incl airport transfer - we went to their sister hotel in Tissa and enjoyed 2 safaris in the greater Yala -all organised by Email and executed seamlessly - Brill . We really like this  place. !
title: Another great team effort

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text:
My wife and I stayed here in February 2024 on a bed and breakfast basis. You can take evening meals at the villa if you choose to do so. The accommodation is excellent. We stayed in Room 4, which is very spacious with a king size comfortable and super large shower/bathroom. The Wi-Fi coverage is superb. Tea and coffee are available on request.
The staff including co owner Rohan and Nalaka & Dilshan and the new gardener were all very friendly and helpful. A special thank you to the chef who cooks the best scrambled egg for breakfast. He also cooked me the best prawn curry and dhal I have ever had!
There is a masseur at the villa and my wife enjoyed a head and back massage at a reasonable cost. 
We ate at a number of local restaurants in clouding Trax, Vintage, Bamboo gardens, Nova and Happy garden. All provide excellent local cuisine at very reasonable prices. If you want to try something very special take lunch or dinner at Mallis, a seafood restaurant on the bank of the Bentota river, a beautiful setting and lovely food. 
While we were at the villa we went on a tour organised by Rohan and his wife/Co-owner Karen.  We stayed at the sister hotel shangri lankan village in Thissa. Again the hotel was excellent.

While at the villa a new pet dog was homed by Rohan. We named him Mario, which the staff and other guests took to very quickly!! 
 
We would highly recommend the villa. We are already in touch with planning a return visit next year.
title: Paradise in Bentota!!

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text:
What an absolute gem, everything about this place is absolutely wonderful and they just get everything right.
The rooms are huge with everything you could possibly need  set in  beautiful grounds and a lovely pool area .
Tea and coffee are available whenever you want it and one of the things I loved was sitting on the balcony early in the morning with a pot of tea. I went down and asked for it on the first morning and then every morning after that ( we stayed for 8 nights) it was automatically brought to me by one of the 2 lovely members of staff.
Rohan is a wealth of knowledge and always willing to help with information and suggestions but we also really enjoyed chatting to him. We ate several lunches there and 2 dinners ,all of which were delicious and the chef was lovely too. We also enjoyed ordering drinks and sitting by the pool with them.
The staff were  fabulous, they always seemed to be around if you needed anything even if they were busy cleaning the rooms or serving food, drinks etc and so friendly and it can't always be easy with limited English.
We also loved the 2 dogs, Jacko and the puppy Mario, the latter had only arrived as a stray the day before we arrived but soon became part of the 'family'!
I had booked directly through Karen who was wonderful at communicating throughout the process and also helped with any queries including a visa issue and arranged a taxi from the airport for us 
We loved being away from all the hustle and bustle of the town and the big busy hotel areas but yet being able to get a tuk tuk ( we ordered them all from Rohan or the staff) at any time and be anywhere in 10/ 15 minutes.
We had a wonderful stay and can fully understand why guests return because we would definitely love to
Thank you to all at Shrangrilanka villa!
title: An all round 5* experience!

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text:
Shangri-Lanka Villa was a great place to spend 6 nights after a busy 7 day tour.
A true taste of Sri Lanka ,set amid lovely gardens and banana/ palm tree plantation,with a lovely pool and a massage hut.There s an array of wildlife in the gardens .Beautiful birds,monkeys ,a land monitor and plenty of frogs.
It was great waking up to such a tropical sound in the mornings.
The owners Rohan and Karen were extremely helpful prior to our visit.
They arranged our driver for us and answered a few questions.
The rooms are very spacious and clean.We had plenty of hanging space ,a great shower in a huge shower room.and a big balcony with table and chairs.The extra large bed was very comfortable and there was a sofa bed.The air con and fan were great and not too noisy,the fridge was also quiet.
We ate at the restaurant a few times and the food was great..Rohan or a member of the team took our dinner orders well in advance as ingredients are fresh and fish is bought to order.There was a good choice of breakfast including fresh fruit,full English and Sri Lankan.
The location is great ,only a short Tuk Tuk ride away from the town and good beaches and beach bars/ restaurants.
The Turtle Conservation project and the River Safari are both a short Tuk Tuk ride away We d recommend both.Rohan booked the boat for us. We saw a range of wildlife including monkeys, crocodiles and kingfishers.
We visited Mali s restaurant for eve dinner which we highly recommend.
Rohan organised Tuk Tuks whenever we wanted them.The drivers were great and came back to pick us up at prearranged times.
Rohan and the team were really helpful. We had drinks delivered to our spacious balcony ,served with a smile and mosquito coils were lit every eve.
We were fortunate to have shared our time here with lovely guests and enjoyed sharing travel tales and recommendations.
We highly recommend Shangri Lanka and hope to return when we next visit Sri Lanka.
title: A lovely place to chill after a busy tour.Highly recommend.

Another relaxing and peaceful holiday at Shangri Lanka (our 4th!). 
A spacious and very comfortable room, great service from the team and excellent choices of food from chef.
Great beach just a few minutes Tuk Tuk ride from the Shangri Lanka and lots of restaurant choices locally.
A very special place!
We‚Äôll be back!

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text:
The most fabulous place to stay! We booked ahead as were recommended by some friends who'd stayed previously, we weren't disappointed! We stayed for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

The Villa was easy to find just off the main road into Bentota. We had our own tuk tuk so travelling around was easy. The staff will also order you a tuk tuk whenever you need it. We arranged a boat trip through Rohan and it was really worth while, saw so much fantastic wild life.

The Villa itself has 6 rooms and a spectacular pool which is perfect to cool off in. Plenty of sunbeds and towels were available plus tea and coffee whenever you wanted it.

Breakfast was included and consisted of a fruit platter, eggs/bacon/sausages/toast etc or pancakes, a personal favourite!

We ate in a couple of times which was lovely but preferred adventuring out to try local restaurants in Bentota, there are many to choose from. Also had a meal at Malli's a local seafood restaurant which was excellent.

Our room was spacious with a large verandah, a four poster bed and a large dressing area with a small kitchen area with fridge sink. The bathroom was vast with a decent shower. The room had everything we needed including amazing air conditioning which we so appreciated.

Karen had been in touch before our visit and answered any query we had, Rohan was there throughout our stay and helped organising anything we needed such as trips, washing and routes to places in our tuk tuk! The staff are all fantastic and we couldn't have wished for a better stay.

The other guests during our stay were lovely too which added to our experience, we were sad to leave but will be back for sure!
title: Amazing place to stay

ownerResponse:
{'id': '937732973', 'text': "Thank you so much for your appreciation of so many aspects of your short stay at Shangri-lanka Villa especially because the positives you have outlined are  what we have aimed to create.

The compliment on delicious food is great acknowledgment for Rohan as unlike the restaurants he insists on it all being cooked fresh and does all the shopping himself daily. However It does mean it costs a little more and he has to have to take the order early as he goes to the harbour late afternoon for seafood orders  and then he and or the chef cooks it. 

We advertise Shangri-Lanka Villa as a guest house with difference not so much professional as more relaxed, easy and friendly almost like a home stay but with all the facilities and services you need. 

We don‚Äôt normally do tours of the room as it feels formal and unnecessary. Rohan is around often but your feedback is helpful to us for understanding different customs needs, thank you.

You were aware Rohan discretely sits on his own veranda organising trips/tours, taxis, tuks etc on the phone rather than in the office, this is just so he available for questions and can see if anybody wants anything staff or guests.
 
We missed the fact you were disappointed which is a big mistake on our part so we are are very sorry about this.

Rohan didn‚Äôt try to overcharge you it was a genuine mistake which he apologised for and rectified immediately without any fuss. I feel you know this as you acknowledged he was busy but  you was upset it wasn‚Äôt completed in advance.

I am not very often at the villa as my role is reservations. We have a sister property  shangri-Lanka Village in Tissamaharama and I spend some time in UK. I didn't realise you expected me to be there so didn't think to explain my personal reasons.

We try to be the best we can be‚Ä¶ we are disappointed to have disappointed you but glad of your appreciation.

Please accept our sincere apologies

", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-11', 'responder': 'Rohan Kodituwakku', 'connectionToSubject': 'Innkeeper'}
placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text:
First the positives-the room we had was clean and spacious with great storage, a comfy bed, a fridge and a fab balcony overlooking the beautiful pool.
The grounds are gorgeous and the pool is the perfect temperature for a cooling dip.
The staff are lovely-hardworking and pleasant even if their English isn‚Äôt great. 
Location is lovely ‚Ä¶not far to walk to the beach and so peaceful. We walked a bit further to go to a beach club but that was through choice to get our steps in. 
Breakfast was delicious and the one evening meal we had there (though expensive compared to what we had at the beach) was also lovely.
Tea and coffee can be served to you at the pool or your balcony free of charge at any time.
Now this is where I disagree with other reviews‚Ä¶the owners. Rohan was always around but sat smoking and on his phone next to the dining area (discreetly however) not particularly friendly or professional. On arrival when we were shown to our room, he didn‚Äôt explain anything about the room, surrounding area or breakfast. Instead asked if we would be wanting dinner and hovered until we ordered. There is however a book explaining certain things but not the things we needed. There was a book about an honesty mini bar which was neither explained or clear as to how to use. We wee checking out early on the morning so before we left to go out for the day, we explained this to Rohan and asked if our bill could be ready to settle that night as we would be leaving so early. (In a taxi he had arranged which was good) 
When we got back the bill wasn‚Äôt ready, nor was the afternoon tea we had requested and he tried to overcharge us. He apologised and said it was because he was busy (it was dinner time but he had had the whole day to prepare the bill) 
As for Karen, who I had been emailing to arrange the stay, including an email whilst we were there, we didn‚Äôt see her at all. She may have had reasons but I would‚Äôve though she would‚Äôve said in the email, sorry I won‚Äôt see you! 
So after looking forward to this part of our trip, we were left disappointed
title: Disappointing

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text: Wow! Amazing place, the villa‚Äôs are beautiful with very comfy beds. Karen, Rohan and the team are great, nothing is too much trouble and they are friendly and helpful. The food is delicious and very reasonably priced. The pool is lovely and the gardens full of wildlife, we saw monkeys in the trees and it‚Äôs a bird watchers paradise. The massage lady is very good too. The beach is very near and Rohan can organise tuk tuk for trips to and back from town or the beach. He will also organise trips to other parts of the island. We can‚Äôt fault this place at all, thanks so much for a wonderful holiday, we wouldn‚Äôt stay anywhere else! xx
title: Wonderful holiday!

placeInfo: {'id': '982341', 'name': 'Shangri-Lanka Villa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 675, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.411506, 'longitude': 80.00733, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d982341-Reviews-Shangri_Lanka_Villa-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.shangrilankavilla.com', 'address': '23 De Alwis Road Horanduwa, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '23 De Alwis Road', 'street2': 'Horanduwa', 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 625}}
text:
From the moment we arrived we felt at home. Karen, Rohan, and their team are so friendly and helpful. The whole atmosphere is relaxed. The rooms are fabulous, exceptionally clean, beautiful decor, very spacious bedrooms and bathrooms with plenty of space for clothes/shoes etc. There is also air conditioning and drinking water in the rooms.
The pool area is tranquil with very comfortable sun loungers. There are many beautiful wild birds that can be seen in the grounds. 
Meals are second to none. The choice is extensive including seafood. We tried the prawns (the biggest I have ever seen), mullet, and lobster. I cannot recommend the food highly enough. Every meal was delicious. You also have the option of eating on your balcony.
The location is perfect, close to the beach, and to shops and bars. 
We went on a 4 day tour in the middle of our stay. This was all organised by Shangri-Lanka Villa. It was amazing. Every detail was taken care of. The vehicle was comfortable and spacious. Our driver was fantastic, and we saw some unforgettable sights and lots of animals including elephants, a sloth bear, and a leopard.
We enjoyed every minute of our stay and hope to return soon.
title: The Most Perfect Place to Stay

roomTip: If you want to do any sightseeing while staying here Rohan will sort you out guided tours with stop overs if required. 5 star organisation.
text:
Had a fantastic couple of weeks here and a massive thank you to Rohan,Karen and their staff for making our stay an enjoyable one.
The staff are polite, and hard working keeping everything running like clockwork.
We spent 2 weeks here on half board and the quality of food was excellent, Rohan would go and get the best fresh fish , prawns in the day and leave the chef to make amazing meals. If you want to eat out just speak to Rohan and he will organise transport and reserve a table for you.
It‚Äôs our third time here and won‚Äôt be our last. 

We highly recommend staying here if you are ever in Sri Lanka the whole accommodation and grounds are immaculate.
title: Sri Lankan Paradise

text:
Had the best time at Villa Benthota. Although we stayed for 1 night the hotel contacted me closer to the date of arrival and offered an upgrad to the Mohotti suite which was a bonus!
Overall the staff were very kind and attentive and the hotel was well maintained...you could sometimes hear the train as the property was bodering the tracks but that didn't bother us as the property had a well maintained foot path to the beach across the tracks. In a nutshell we had a fabulous time at Villa Benthota. Will definitely come back!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '972612201', 'text': 'Dear Mr Malinga
It seems that you are aggrieved, simply because you were denied a refund for a cancellation when checking into the hotel, and therefore determined to find fault where possible. 
I seriously dispute your claim that the ‚Äúdrainage system is a disaster‚Äù. This is a Heritage Property, and whilst some of the showers maybe slow to drain due to narrow gauge pipes, it is hardly a disaster. The shower did not flood, it just took time to drain. 
With regards to the trains, we are totally transparent about the proximity of the railway line - we even have a video with the train going past the hotel on the home page of our website. The trains do not run all night, and as you can see from the many other flattering reviews, guests view this as a bonus and not something negative. Clearly you did not do your homework.
For someone who claims to be from the industry, you should know that when making a booking, you enter into a contract with a hotel, and that there are terms and conditions attached. These are included in the invoice sent you when you made the booking. Our cancellation policy is fairly standard throughout the industry, and as a boutique hotel with a small inventory, we cannot afford not to stick to those terms. 
You asked to cancel one room and reduce two nights from another room booking, and all of this on the day of arrival. For you to expect us to agree to this with no charge is unreasonable ‚Äì we are unlikely to sell the rooms and therefore this is a loss for us. We simply asked you to pay 50%. Perhaps if you had asked nicely, instead of bullying my staff, we might have been more amenable to your request. As it is, to vent your spleen you have written this review whilst still in the hotel since you had asked for late checkout, which we have agreed to free of charge. Seems no good turn goes unrewarded!
Yours,
George Cooper', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-04', 'responder': 'George Cooper', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1637352', 'name': 'The Villa Bentota by KK Collection', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 715, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.414413, 'longitude': 79.99899, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d1637352-Reviews-The_Villa_Bentota_by_KK_Collection-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.kkcollection.com/', 'address': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 11, 'count3': 23, 'count4': 129, 'count5': 536}}
text:
I had high expectations for this ‚Äúheritage property,‚Äù but unfortunately, it was a letdown. First, the drainage system is a disaster‚Äîit simply doesn‚Äôt work. Be prepared for bathroom issues during your stay.

The worst part, though, is the location. It‚Äôs right next to train tracks, and let me tell you, good luck getting any sleep with trains roaring past at all hours. If you‚Äôre after peace and tranquility, this is definitely not the place.

Now, be very careful when booking because the cancellation policies are extremely strict. They seem far more focused on squeezing every penny out of their guests than actually providing good service. Despite the hotel being barely 30% full, there‚Äôs zero flexibility or consideration. Don‚Äôt expect any understanding from management either‚ÄîGeorge, in particular, made sure that every detail of their penny-pinching policies was enforced to the letter, leaving no room for discussion.

It‚Äôs unfortunate to say, but the KK Collection seems more interested in protecting their bottom line than in ensuring guests have a pleasant experience.
title: Disappointing Experience at The Villa Bentota by KK Collection

text: This hotel was the final destination of 6 hotels during our tour around Sri Lanka over a 10 day period and it was perfect for a couple of days relaxation at the end of a busy wonderful holiday. Beautiful grounds, fabulous room and a hotel full of such character, we couldn't have asked for more. Loved the train which runs through the grounds! Such fun and not obtrusive so don't be put off by it. Stunning beach with wonderful sunsets. Staff amazing! Can't do enough for you! Loved this hotel and would definitely stay again
title: Fabulously beautiful, unique hotel with wonderful staff

ownerResponse:

placeInfo: {'id': '1637352', 'name': 'The Villa Bentota by KK Collection', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 715, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.414413, 'longitude': 79.99899, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d1637352-Reviews-The_Villa_Bentota_by_KK_Collection-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.kkcollection.com/', 'address': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 11, 'count3': 23, 'count4': 129, 'count5': 536}}
text:
A real mixed review, sadly the negatives outweighed the positives for us.  Firstly though the hotel staff were amazing here and they cannot be faulted (except the spa employee) for any negative reviews.  The food was lovely and the restaurant staff who looked after us during our stay, although young were very friendly and attentive.  We had water brought out to our sunbeds during the day without request,  and even watermelon one of the days.  If you were to eat in the restaurant the prices were higher than most we saw, and the drinks including alcohol were amount the most expensive - twice the price of some of the other places we stayed in our trip.

The building itself was beautifully constructed and lots of thoughtful chill out areas.  However it stopped there.  The rooms were quite worn round the edges and needed updating, the doors didn't close properly and although our room was clean enough it was basic and not luxury at all.  The high standards from some of the other hotels we stayed in left us very disappointed which was a shame as we were here for 4 nights.  

One of the main issues for us, which I haven't seen mentioned in other reviews I've glanced at (surprisingly) was the train track.  Online it very cleverly says the train STATION is 6km from the hotel.  What it doesn't say is that the TRACK is right behind the swimming pool with the crossing with access to the outside track (no security).  If you planned on a chilled, relaxed time by the pool be prepared for a train go past honking it's loud horn and blasting out a lot of toxic smoke and pollution.  The track was so close to the hotel that when we were in our room at night the windows would rattle with the force of the train going past, and the sound of the horn kept waking us up.   The only time we had respite was between 12.30-4am 3.5 hours of no service!!

We also had a very bad experience of the "Spa and Wellness centre".  For starters, it shouldn't be called this.  It was a dimly lit room with a table in the middle of it.  The towel on the bed was a pool towel, and the worker there didn't have a clue about the treatments he was giving.  Reflexology was more like a very painful sports massage - and the manicure was a very painful massacre of the nails - it was so bad we had to walk out the treatments.  The equipment that was being used was old and worn, the nail file had rust on it.  When I asked for the treatment to stop the employee got angry and confused, I told him he was hurting me but he told me to sit back down, I immediately left and reported it to reception.  The manager didn't really do much except apologise and tell us we didn't need to pay for the "treatments".  I would not recommend the spa at all.

Sadly, we wouldn't choose to stay here again, and just make sure you check any hotels along this strip as they all pretty much back onto the noisy train line!

(You can see how close the train is in the photos, we did take a video which showed this too and the noise but can‚Äôt post it!)
title: In need of improvement, train line too close to hotel, and the "spa" is one to be missed!

placeInfo: {'id': '1637352', 'name': 'The Villa Bentota by KK Collection', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 715, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.414413, 'longitude': 79.99899, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d1637352-Reviews-The_Villa_Bentota_by_KK_Collection-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.kkcollection.com/', 'address': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 11, 'count3': 23, 'count4': 129, 'count5': 536}}
text: Perfectly located on the west coast, within easy distance of the Airport, cool beaches in the South of Hiri and Dikwella, mountains of Ella and the Nine Elms Bridge as well as the National Parks and Historical Fort Galle.   Villa Bentota is a small residence, with just a handful of beautifully appointed rooms I stayed in one of the suites with a lovely terrace overlooking the gardens and the beach in the distance.  Checking in on a Sunday morning, i was pre warned my room would not be ready as it was occupied (thank you for heads up) but was expecting a massive Sri Lankan welcome which simply did not happen - check in was functional, keys and money.  My room was lovely, huge (triple aspect) and with a great view, lovely bed and sumptuous linens and throws. Huge bathroom with a shower and a bath as well as double sink.  Lovely smell of cinnamon oil gently burning to warn off the bugs.   I would liked to have seen more luxury ameneties, candles, speaker and flowers - charged 1750 rupees for a disposable razor was a bit much.   The room was spotlessly clean, the staff looking after the rooms were really amazing, always on hand to assist working around guest schedule .  Good WIFI both in common areas and a room specific - although it did not work in the breakfast room. Outside of the hotel was spotless, a team of gardeners constantly working on the property as well as at the beach just a short walk across the track.  Small restaurant overlooking gardens, lovely spot with a menu to suit all tastes however i would have liked to have seen more variety and perhaps daily specials or a grill evening - breakfast was underwhelming in terms of choices although  what was offered was of good quality.  Restaurant staff were also great, going above and beyond .   Overall this is a really really lovely property, with fab staff and adequate amenities - personally I would add a few more touches, to take from good to great not only in the rooms but as part of the welcome, and in terms of offering advise on day trips and local attractions.    I will definitely be coming back again, so will not share my room number as I want to keep it free for me üòâ
title: Lovely Oasis of Tranquility and Calm.  Feels like staying with a family

text: Our first stay at Villa Bentota and a really wonderful experience. We had the Mohotti Suite which was the original walauwa on the property. Designed by Geoffrey Bawa the hotel and grounds provide a beautiful environment for relaxing and enjoying the great service ,food and pool. A bar set up on the beach at sunset made for a perfect place for a pre dinner cocktail. Highly recommend a stay here if visiting Bentota. Geoffrey Bawa's garden is just across the street and Bevis Bawas "Brief Garden" is a 10 minute drive. Both worth visiting.
title: A wonderful stay at Villa Bentota

text:
Our recent stay at Villa Bentota will stay with us forever. It was one of those places that hit every single high note for what we wanted. It is the embodiment of heritage boutique - the design and architecture by Geoffrey Bawa is unique and delivers interest wherever you turn.¬†

The service is outstanding. It is clear everyone works as a team and strive to ensure guests are happy and want for nothing. All Villa Bentota personnel were professional, friendly, attentive and efficient. They appeared to take great pride in being employees of the hotel.

Our room, suite 4, was delightful. Roomy, clean, beautifully decorated, and very comfortable. We loved our huge balcony overlooking the gardens, coconut palms, and of course, the railway line. Loved the railway line - a real feature!

The food and drinks, and accompanying service, is excellent. Yes, you pay a bit more for the restaurant meals and bar drinks, but everything about Villa Bentota is an experience and the rewards are in the staying there. Breakfast is fresh, great in variety, and prepared to order. My wife is coeliac and was provided with gluten free bread and all meal ingredients were carefully checked before being served. Ruwan and his food and beverage team were wonderful, with incredible attention to detail at all times.

Thank you to the whole team at Villa Bentota. You made for a very memorable stay.
title: Peace, calm, tranquility, service

text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights here. The staff were excellent & friendly. Our room (suite 6) was very comfortable & quiet, situated at the far end. The property had several zones, beautifully furnished for relaxation. The pool area was wonderful with good sized shady umbrellas & large towels. Cold water was brought to us regularly. The shop was actually very interesting with local art & handicrafts & we did buy a few souvenirs! Breakfast was delicious & well worth ordering Sri Lankan curry & hoppers the night before. The dinner menu was a little limited but we enjoyed all our meals, especially the curries. We enjoyed the individuality of the hotel & the train running through the bottom of the garden didn‚Äôt worry us at all-it was fun to see local people going on their journeys. We only walked on the beach once. It was beautiful but the humidity & heat kept us near the pool.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '1637352', 'name': 'The Villa Bentota by KK Collection', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 715, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.414413, 'longitude': 79.99899, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d1637352-Reviews-The_Villa_Bentota_by_KK_Collection-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.kkcollection.com/', 'address': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 11, 'count3': 23, 'count4': 129, 'count5': 536}}
text:
We do not recognise the hotel we stayed in from the descriptions and comments in most of the previous reviews nor the website.

This hotel was the most expensive hotel of the 10 5 star hotels we stayed in during our 18 night tour of Sri Lanka in February 2024.  It was also one of the most rustic, primitive and lacking in luxury.  As such it truly was the poorest value for money.  Maybe other guests were seeking a different type of experience from a hotel that boasts on its website 'contemporary styled', 'boutique hotel', 'extensive renovation ..... affordable luxury' and more.  The accurate word that is used is 'heritage' for which read basic and very worn at the edges as the buildings are very old.  What's more we are fans of Geoffrey Bawa's architecture and visited several of his highest regarded properties, including other hotels.  We clearly had different expectations.  

If you are a mozzie magnet, this is not the hotel for you - or maybe not the room we stayed in, 'four'.   It had 3 doors directly to the outside from the bedroom, none of which closed well.  The bathroom was entirely open to the elements on one side, letting in not just the mozzies but all manner of other flying or crawling bugs and creepie crawlies, too.  It was the only place where I got bitten, despite using the provided mosquito net over the bed.  

This room also had no privacy because directly outside the window was a lawn that had staff passing as they tended to the grounds and other guests strolling by constantly.  Worse, it had a direct view from the train.  The blinds need to be fully shut owing to their design, so you get no daylight or face being on display.    

How other guests can consider the train an interesting feature is beyond me.  Maybe they do not get woken by a train that runs until midnight and then starts up at 4:30 in the morning, tooting loudly as it noisily trundles by.  Take your own earplugs; none were provided in the room.

For a luxury, boutique hotel the security is a joke.  There's a charade about exclusivity to gain access from the road, cars need to toot and drivers explain themselves to a security guard to open the huge metal gate to gain entry.  Yet the back of the hotel is open to anybody who walks along the train line - many villagers seem to commute daily or just stroll along this way - and there is full access to anybody from the beach which can be reached by the general public.  One nosy guest from a neighbouring hotel just wandered in thinking it might be a restaurant, so anybody can do the same.

We were told with great fanfare about their beachside sunset tiki bar.  As the hotel provides no loungers on the beach in front of the hotel and just erects a make shift bar to serve a limited range of over priced and strange cocktails, this is a huge missed opportunity.  The first guests bagged the 2 chairs or sat on a few tree stumps, the rest of us stood up looking like idiots with nowhere to rest our drinks.  Given the small, boutique hotel emphasis, they could even have made more of the feature, even created a setting for guests to meet each other.

The food was OK, but the menu is very short and there was an emphasis on 'western' dishes.  If you wanted local food, you had to request this well ahead, and then the choices were limited.  Despite other reviewers stating they could choose off menu if nothing suited, nobody mentioned this at any meal to us.   

The staff was the best feature.  There were many of them, and they did seem to aim to please.
title: Overpriced, underwhelming

placeInfo: {'id': '1637352', 'name': 'The Villa Bentota by KK Collection', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 715, 'locationString': 'Bentota, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.414413, 'longitude': 79.99899, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297895-d1637352-Reviews-The_Villa_Bentota_by_KK_Collection-Bentota_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.kkcollection.com/', 'address': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Bentota', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 11, 'count3': 23, 'count4': 129, 'count5': 536}}
text:
This was our 8th hotel during a month long trip to Sri Lanka. We had high expectations for Villa Bentota and were very excited about our 5 night stay, having recently stayed at 3 different boutique style hotel/villas, all with outstanding personal service.  Villa Bentota never quite met our expectations nor the previous service levels that we had received during our trip. 

The property and grounds are stunning, as well  the beach which is just across the train track at the bottom of the gardens. The rooms are lovely and the linens etc. are all of a high quality, including the beds ( we slept well).

The food and beverage is a bit pricey compared with other hotels in Sri Lanka, but comparable to international rates. There were a few things which were more than double the price of other SL hotels we visited.

We found the breakfast and dinner a little disappointing for various reasons given our very high expectations. 

We tended to gravitate towards the beach each day, rather than the pool area. The Villa has two sun beds on a fairly deserted stretch of beach. We did ask the Villa team to put on the sun pads each day, to make things a little more comfortable. The Villa has  a small beach bar that operates for sun downers  from 5pm to 7pm,  again it's quite pricey when compared against the neighbouring properties beach bars. There is no refreshment service on the beach from the villa outside the sundown hours, however there are neighbouring beach bars fairly close that we used during the day.  Like the property the beach is stunning .                                      
 
Service from the Manager was excellent when we asked him for anything, it was dealt with immediately.       
                                                                                         We did experience quite a few small service shortfalls during our stay.

The Villa has enormous potential to be really something special.
title: Mixed feelings

text:
We spent 5 very pleasant days here at the end of our tour of the country and thoroughly enjoyed the extremely welcoming beachside location with onsite swimming pool and beautiful gardens.

The rooms are well decorated and maintained with very attractive  views across the gardens towards the beach (which is behind the treeline and a two minute walk across the railway track). Large bathroom, room and balcony. We had room 7.

The restaurant provides good quality food, although quite pricey compared to local restaurants and also the menu was the same each night and could do with a bit of variation. Breakfast is served in the rear garden area and was very good.
Service all round was attentive. They even decorated our room on the night of my wife‚Äôs birthday and provided a birthday cake as a surprise. Thank you for this much appreciated gesture.
title: Restful end of tour

text:
The property takes you back to a colonial past with a perfect blend of past glory and modern luxury. 

To start off, the team was very courteous is upgrading our rooms to accommodate a better stay for our kids. The rooms are huge with large verandas. The bed was super comfy,  the view from the balconies - amazing, and 2 very nice pools to enjoy. 

The standout feature for us was the beach (just across the train line) and exceptional house keeping service. 

The one thing that I feel could be better is the food
title: Quaint and comfortable!

roomTip: Just be aware that tre train passes near by, so if you have trouble sleeping, bring your ear plugs
text:
Very clean, comfortable and spacious room, the food was great, they made us non spicy versions of everything, they helped me with the beach flee bites, with cutting off some aloe vera leaves, they even let us stay in our room longer, until 9p.m. The beach is very near, the front yard is fabulous, ans the pool was cleaned every day. The staff was really really great and helpful.
What we couldn't read about, when we booked the hotel is that the train passes right next to it (so my ear pluggs really helped), the beach was pretty dirty (but we were there out of season) and at the reception, for the last two days, there was a guy knowing zero English. He didn't even understand to call someone who does. But anyway, we would go there again
title: Very, very nice experience

text: Great position near the beach ,and on the railway line in Bentota. Wonderful friendly and kind staff, in all areas of the hotel. Our room was spacious with a beautiful large balcony. However the whole property is dated and tired , stained toilet and sinks, a rusty fridge ,and holes in the bed sheets gave the whole bedroom a grubby appearance.  I felt it needed deep cleaning. Breakfast was ok,  fruit, toast , eggs etc, but evening meals very average, so only eat there once.
title: Seen better days.........

roomTip: Asians avoid this hotel
text:
Warning to Indians/Pakistanis/Bangladeshis/Sri Lankan

Do not book this hotel as we had to cancel it after reaching the place due to brothel like dirty rooms with broken mirror, malfunctioning tv , no telephone lines in room & loafer like receptionist staff completely uneducated and ill-mannered are not even fit to be house maids let alone receptionist, I repeat do not book this hotel we have escalated it to Sri Lankan tourism & racism board as the staff sitting at the hotel lobby are racist &  disgusting and rest of the staff looked - behaved like goons and provided us rooms where sober people cannot live. They will not care about Asians & only best provide rooms and service to Europeans & Russians(dollars) & completely racist culture prevails. The staff laughed when we complained about rooms & had goons/auto rickshawalas locals with them. We asked to talk to the manager they said he is not available and asked to cancel the rooms. The property is good & they have good rooms but staff is just classless uncouth.Sri Lankan & Indian tourism authorities will take action to get property delisted from major travel portals & highlight this incident to concerned authorities. We have the incident recorded as video evidence as well. Staff reception behaviour was just shocking in what they call 3 star hotel. The receptionist team deserve to be fired immediately & learnt to be taught manners & how to talk & behave with tourist on whose funds they are getting their salary.
title: Warning to Indians/Pakistanis/Bangladeshis/Sri Lankan

roomTip: Avoid this resort, you have better alternatives.
text:
Just checked in today on May 21st, 2024 and I am already fed up and writing this review on the same day after checking in.

Firstly checkin was not smooth they have twin seperate beds for a family, not sure how can the kid sleep in between 2 joint beds.
This was solved by arguing with them and taking an alternative room.

Next and most important WIFI works only the lobby. Inside rooms there is no WIFI signal.

Next TVs not working.

Finally ACs are built near main entrance of rooms and water is dripping continuously making your entry to room slippery and not convenient at all.

Not sure without WIFI and without TVs what we are going to do in this useless resort for couple of days stay.

PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESORT NOT WORTH EVEN A SINGLE PENNY.
title: Horrible not worth even a single star

text:
I will start with the positives... this hotel is  set on a beatiful beach with  sun loungers and towels available to use for free of charge. It has stunning views from the room the rooms were large and spacious with large balcony with lush views .
The shower room was large and shower worked well .
Well cleaned daily if wanted by yourself .

Now for the negatives ... this hotel is fat away from everything.  
The hotel advertised currency exchange which was not available so we actually had very little sri lankan cash on us as at end few days of holiday. Didn't even have enough for tuk or taxi to nearest bank or atm so kinda stuck there  ( luckily able to pay everything in hotel via card at end of stay )

The breakfast provided was below standard and the fruits and cake were all left uncovered for flys to land on.
The menu available for food to buy was limited and very expensive for food and drink but again no where close buy to walk to to eat out. 
The staff although friendly were very hard to communicate with even to order a drink 
During our stay the pool was at times unavailable to use due to works on the hotel we were not notified of this before our stay There are only 4 lounger by pool for medium  sized hotel .
This hotel has so much potential it needs a small shop as nothing close by...and drink and snack bar by the beach. 
fairly priced menu as so expensive.  better breakfast options.
title: This hotel did not meet our expectations
